It sounds like you had a great day on Lake Michigan!

For the Arkansas River trip, you won't need to bring a curly tail spinnerbait or any other type of spinning gear. Since you're going on a guided float trip and targeting brown trout, fly fishing will be the primary method. Your guide will likely provide expert advice on the best flies and techniques to use, and you can focus on honing your fly fishing skills.

Fly fishing is the most popular and effective method for catching trout on the Arkansas River, and your guide will help you present the right flies to the fish. The river's structure, currents, and trout behavior are well-suited for fly fishing, and you'll have a better chance of catching trout using flies specifically designed for the river's conditions.

Leave the spinnerbait and other spinning gear at home, and focus on preparing your fly fishing gear and skills for the trip. Make sure to bring a good selection of flies, leaders, and tippet material, as well as a well-maintained fly rod and reel.

If you have any questions or concerns about your fly gear or techniques, be sure to ask your guide during the trip. They'll be happy to provide tips and guidance to help you catch more trout and make the most of your time on the water.
